{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3627769,"name":"Tio","username":"Tio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d2c977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-18T00:45:59.150Z","cooked":"

Hi

Hi everyone,

Our team is currently working on integrating vision into our robot. We’re using a swerve drive system built entirely with Cross The Road Electronics hardware, and we’ve added an Orange Pi 5 running PhotonVision, along with two ThriftyCams.

Our goal is to have the robot autonomously drive to specific AprilTags placed on the field.

My main question is:
Do we need access to a full field (or even a half field) to develop and test this functionality effectively?
Unfortunately, we don’t have the space to set up a full or half field at our school.

We’d appreciate any advice or experiences you can share — especially from teams who have developed tag-tracking and autonomous navigation in more limited spaces.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-18T00:45:59.150Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":92.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501963,"topic_slug":"adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field","display_username":"Tio","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28847,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field/501963/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3627775,"name":"Owen Tharp","username":"Grumpy_Bud","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/e274bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-18T00:55:20.525Z","cooked":"

If you are going to be doing full field testing, yes. However, if you are just testing basic driving to pose that is totally possible to test on a very small field. You may have to get a bit creative, and the results will not always mimic a full field, but it usually gets the job done. This thread goes over quick ways to get automatic driving set up if your interested: From zero to auto align to reef tutorial how to simply auto align to the reef

The main challenge will be acurracy. You could just hold up tags in front of the robot, but if they are in the wrong position you may get strange results from your code. Also, you may take it to competition and be going to all the wrong places.

Here is our 1/4 field that we roll up each night.
We were able to develop a pretty consistent 4 coral auto with it. Some key points:
Accurate position of game elements. We mark positions with tape to ensure they are accurate.
Make sure you have the correct April tags. One of our mentors made slots so we could easily swap tags to test different configurations.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-18T01:04:46.028Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":501963,"topic_slug":"adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field","display_username":"Ian McTavish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/ysdm0vYjQ0k?si=loqbeOZ_oDGlgcry","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":26}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17356,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field/501963/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3627915,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-18T04:27:53.099Z","cooked":"
Tio:

Our goal is to have the robot autonomously drive to specific AprilTags placed on the field.

If you are just trying to align to a specific tag your camera can see and the camera can see that tag for most of the desired drive path, the absence of a field is only a minor hurdle.

If you are trying to continuously compute your pose on the field based on any tags your cameras can see and you want to drive to an arbitrary location, that is going to be a lot harder to test without at least a half field for a game like Reefscape (which was largely played on a half field) and without a full field where acquisition, scoring, or both are taking place on the opposite side of the field from the driver stations.

Simulation of vision and your drive chassis could go a long way towards supporting development of full-field pose estimation and drive-to-pose. Once everything is working in simulation, you should be able to test bits and pieces of it in real life. If you don’t have much space, you won’t be able to test the way multi-tag vision pose estimates will work on a real field where your cameras are seeing some close and some far tags. Depending on the game and task, distant tags might not be adding much and you could filter those out so your limited testing is closer to the way things would work on a competition field.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-18T04:27:53.099Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501963,"topic_slug":"adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/adding-vision-to-swerve-drive-robot-with-thriftycams-and-orange-pi-do-we-need-a-full-field/501963/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3627928,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-18T05:28:17.468Z","cooked":"

for the kind of initial development you’re talking about, I’d suggest making a practice field json layout with only a few tags in whatever your practice space is – you could tape a single tag to a chair, and that would be a good enough “field” to get started with. Write an auton that orbits the chair. Or you could put a tag at either end of your space and drive back and forth. Whatever you put in the json, that’s your practice field, it could be 10x10 feet and you’d learn a lot.
